What Is an Electronics Problem Statement?
A problem statement is a clear description of an issue that can be solved using electronics and
embedded systems.
It should answer:
What is the issue?
Who is facing it?
Where and when does it occur?
Why is electronics a good way to solve it?
What benefit do we get by solving it?

Examples: Weak vs Strong
Weak: “Smart irrigation project.”
Strong:
In farm areas, farmers waste water because they cannot know soil moisture levels. A
sensor-based automatic irrigation system can avoid over-watering and save water.
Weak: “Automatic street light.”
Strong:
In campus walkways, lights remain ON even when no one is present, wasting energy.
A motion- and light-sensing controller can reduce electricity consumption.

How to Identify Real Problems
Observe your hostel, labs, classrooms and campus
Talk to students, faculty and workers about daily issues
Check online: similar projects, research gaps, new ideas
Always ask: Who is affected and how can electronics help?
